result.execSummary:
The defendant Eric Lamont Finley was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Burglary-Building or Dwelling, a class F felony, Wisconsin Statutes 943.10(1m)(a).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes: Credit given for 5 days if revoked.
Extended Supervision and Probation Conditions the same.

miscConds.notes:
Pay the balance of all applicable court costs, fees, and surcharges - to be paid over a period of probation. Failure to pay will result in a civil judgment.
Provide a DNA sample (unless previously done) and pay DNA surcharge - to be paid over a period of probation. Failure to pay will result in a civil judgment.
Court set restitution at zero.
Court advised defendant that as a convicted felon he may never possess a firearm or body armor.
No contact with the victim, Brooke H.
Comply with the standard rules of probation/extended supervision. Court advised defendant that his voting rights are suspended, and may not vote in any election until his civil rights are restored.

Cooperate and participate with an AODA assessment and follow any recommended treatment
Maintain absolute sobriety and submit to random urine screens.

timeConds.notes:
With release privileges for employment purposes.
Court ordered GOOD TIME CREDIT as to condition time.

records.addlTxt: Signed Earned Release Program/Substance Abuse Program Order mailed to DEPARTMENT OF CORRECTIONS ATTN: RECORDS 2909 E. PARK AVE.CHIPPEWA FALLS WI 54729

Filed, signed Amendment to Judgment of Conviction and Order.  
It is ordered that the Department of Corrections will effectuate the change from Confinement to Extended Supervision upon receipt of this order, determining the actual number of days served in Confinement and changing the remaining Confinement to Extended Supervision.  The number of days that are converted from Confinement Time to Extended Supervision will be determined by a DOC records office staff member and will be based upon actual release date.
It is further ordered that the Warden/Superintendent of the institution to which the prisoner is assigned shall effect his or her release within 6 working days upon receipt of this order.
DOC is requesting the Court to authorize the inmate's release and conversion of remaining confinement time to extended supervision.  Assigned to Br.18 Judge Judge Colon.

Per order of Presiding Judge, Felony Division, this request/motion is hereby assigned to the Hon. M. Joseph Donald, Br. 2, for review. jbs
Defendant's pro se request for additional release privileges (14 hrs/day).

Defendant Eric Lamont Finley in court with attorney Jeffrey A. Schwarz.  Catelin Ringersma appeared for the State of Wisconsin.

Sentencing proceeds. Statements made by the State, defense and defendant.

AS TO COUNT 1:    The Court sentenced defendant to serve a term of IMPRISONMENT in the Wisconsin State Prisons for 8 YEARS.  
INITIAL CONFINEMENT of 4 YEARS and EXTENDED SUPERVISION of 4 YEARS.
Credit given for 5 days time served if revoked.

Court finds defendant is eligible for the Challenge Incarceration Program.
Court finds defendant is eligible for the Wisconsin Substance Abuse Program.

Court STAYS sentence and placed defendant on probation for a period of 4 years under the supervision of Wisconsin Department of Corrections.

CONDITIONS OF PROBATION/EXTENDED SUPERVISION:
* Comply with the standard rules of probation/extended supervision.
* SERVE 1 YEAR "condition time" with release privileges for employment purposes only.
* No contact with the victim, Brooke H.
* Cooperate and participate with an AODA assessment and follow any recommended treatment.
* Maintain absolute sobriety and submit to random urine screens.
* Provide a DNA sample (unless previously done) and PAY DNA surcharge - to be paid over a period of probation.  Failure to pay will result in a civil judgment. 
* PAY the balance of all applicable court costs, fees, and surcharges - to be paid over a period of probation.  Failure to pay will result in a civil judgment. 

OTHER COURT ORDERS:
* Court set restitution at ZERO.
* Court ordered "GOOD TIME CREDIT" as to the condition time.
  
Court advised defendant that as a convicted felon he may never possess a firearm or body armor.  
Court advised defendant that his voting rights are suspended, and may not vote in any election until his civil rights are restored.
Appeal rights given.

(DEFENDANT REMANDED INTO CUSTODY WITH THE SHERIFF'S DEPARTMENT IN COURT)

Filed:
Written Explanation of Determinate Sentence.
Notice of Right to Seek Postconviction Relief.
Justice Point Pretrial Report.
Defendant's Character Witness Letter.

Defendant Eric Lamont Finley in court with attorney Jeffrey A. Schwarz.  Catelin Ringersma appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
 
This matter was originally scheduled for a Final Pretrial Conference today, however, the parties have now reached an agreement.

AS TO COUNT 1:    Defendant changes plea to GUILTY "as charged". Defendant examined as to his plea, advised of his Constitutional rights and the maximum penalty. Court found that defendant freely, voluntarily and intelligently waived his rights. Parties stipulate to the complaint as a factual basis to sustain defendant's plea. Court found defendant guilty as charged in the information and ordered a Judgment of Conviction be entered on the record. Defendant is advised he is a convicted felon and may not possess any firearms or body armor. Defendant is advised he is unable to vote in any election until civil rights are restored. Defendant further advised that if he is not a US citizen deportation is possible.  

Parties request to adjourn the sentencing phase.
Court GRANTS request. 
Case adjourned to 11-06-2014 at 8:30 AM - Br. 2, Judge Donald's Court for Sentencing Hearing.

**Defendant's conditions of bail release remain the same.
